Vocabularies.Definition: n.  an element or side of a situation or idea 方面
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You have only considered one aspect of the problem, but there are many.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 权威人士（或机构）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He is an authority on plant diseases.

Vocabularies.Definition: help to cause 促成，有助于，是… 的部分原因
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Various factors contributed to his downfall.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  not refined 粗糙的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His manners are rather crude.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  have control of or a very strong influence on 支配， 统治
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He has authority, but he doesn't try to dominate others.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of an economy or economics 经济（学）的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The country is in a bad economic state.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  go beyond in quantity, degree, etc. 超过 e.g.   The cost will not exceed $500.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The cost will not exceed $500.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  real, not fake or artificial  真的，非伪造的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It's either a genuine diamond or a very good fake.

Vocabularies.Definition: yield to 对…让步，屈服于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It seems the President has given way to pressure from hard-liners.

Vocabularies.Definition: in the course of changing into another state or condition 在过渡时期，在转变过程中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The company is still in transition from one boss to another.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make into a whole 使成一整体
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Foreign immigrants here don't integrate well into the white community.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   declare or tell in advance 预言
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The earthquake was predicted several weeks ago.

Vocabularies.Definition: n., a.  专业人员（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You need a professional to sort out your finances.

Vocabularies.Definition: free oneself from 使自己摆脱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The country is making attempts to rid itself of corruption.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.，vi.  改变，变动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She hastily shifted the subject.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   (high) social position 地位，身份
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The success of her book has given her unexpected celebrity status.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    客观的，有分量的；重大的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   That is a very substantial improvement in the present situation.

Vocabularies.Definition: to give just a few examples 仅举几例
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Lots of our friends are coming: Anne, Ken and George, to name but a few.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. general tendency or direction 趋势
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It is obvious from the graph that there is an upward trend in coal production.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  being the only one of its kind 独特的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   None of these social problems are unique to this country.
